node.text:
HSPs are often negatively described as “too sensitive.” But being an HSP isn’t a bad thing. Like any personality trait, it comes with challenges, but also many strengths. 

Here are some positive traits I can see in highly sensitive people I know, including me. 💗 

Do you consider yourself to be an HSP? If so,  do you recognize yourself in these traits? Let 
me know in the comments and feel free to add other strengths/positive traits that I may have forgotten! 💭

✨Follow @what.is.mental.illness for 
more educational content!
_________________

#HSP #highlysensitiveperson 
#highlysensitive #empath #selflove
#empower #empowerment

node.text:
Which advice most resonates most with you?💭

To make your life a little easier, I compiled some of the best advice that people have received from therapists. Hopefully some of these may spark a little a-ha moment for you! 

Drop your best mental health advice in the comments! Let’s help others by creating a huge advice’s chain. 🤍

✨Follow @what.is.mental.illness for 
more educational content!
_________________

Photo shared by Jade | Special Educator on September 15, 2021 tagging @katies.self.care.diaries. May be an image of text that says 'Things people with Depressior do that can come across "lazy" @what.is.mental.illnessx @katies.self.care.diaries Oversleeping and staying in bed all day Not much in group discussions Postponing tasks Cancelling plans Neglecting personal hygiene Ordering takeouts Appearing withdrawn Falling behind on housework'.

node.text:
Drop a ❤️ in the comments if you agree!

Depression isn’t just mental, it’s physical too. Those people who suffer and find it affects their eating habits, or their sleeping pattern will feel the very real physical effects of that.

The mental exhaustion of depression is never ending, and despite what some are quick to perceive as laziness, there are reasons for the behaviours that people suffering from depression exhibit.

It’s difficult to know who uses their phone as a distraction and who is just addicted to using it.

The one thing that you can do to support someone with depression is talk with them. Provide a safe space for them to open up about their worries, and be understanding of their habits when they are suffering a depressive episode. (Caption from "Things People With Depression Do That May Come Across As Lazy”)

🎨 Collaboration with the amazing @katies.self.care.diaries 

✨ Follow @what.is.mental.illness for 
more mental health tools & resources 
_________________

node.text:
CLOSED. I’m really excited to announce that I am partnering with @treatmyocd to offer a GIVEAWAY of 2 months of free therapy with a NOCD therapist!!! 

Finding a trained OCD specialist is extremely important. NOCD offers affordable, accessible effective therapy in all the US and now outside the US.

For a chance to win :
1- Follow both @treatmyocd & @what.is.mental.illness
2- Download the free NOCD app (link in bio!)
3- Like this post! 

For an extra entry: 
Share this post to your stories and please tag both @treatmyocd and @what.is.mental.illness so that we can see your share. If your account is private, please screenshot your story and DM it to @treatmyocd and what.is.mental.illness, so we can count it.

✨ Follow @what.is.mental.illness for 
more mental health tools & resources 
_________________

Photo shared by Jade | Special Educator on August 19, 2021 tagging @treatmyocd. May be an image of text that says 'OCD can make you doubt your... @what.is.mental.illness @treatmyocd Intentions Memory Perceptions Sanity Identity Thoughts Diagnosis Values Emotions'.

node.text:
Obsessive Compulsive Disorder is often called “the doubting disease.” But what does doubt have to do with obsessions and compulsions? In fact, one of the driving forces of the compulsions is chronic doubt. Compulsions must be compelled repeatedly because of the fear that something has been overlooked despite repeated efforts. Doubt fuels the fire for the OCD cycle, so there is no room for doubt or uncertainty. 

To help you learn if you have the condition and access effective therapy, I’ve partnered with NOCD. NOCD’s mission is to end the suffering caused by OCD. To find out if you’re struggling with OCD, schedule a live face-to-face video session with one of NOCD’s licensed therapists. During their first session, your therapist will give you a comprehensive diagnostic assessment to help you understand if OCD is impacting your life. If you have the condition, they’ll then offer you proven treatment. #ocd #nocd #ocdtherapy #erptherapy

node.text:
Put a ❤️ in the comments if you can relate! 
#youarenotalone

PART 2 entire made by @what.is.mental.illness ‘s community 🤍 A special thank you for all your answers. The purpose of this project is to give people living with trauma the space to be heard and to raise awareness the impacts. 

If you need help right now, don’t hesitate and call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-8255. You can also text START to 741-741 to reach the Crisis Text Line. 

Follow @what.is.mental.illness 
for more educational content. ❤️
_____________________________

#trauma #ptsd #cptsd
#ptsdawareness #ptsdrecovery 
#ptsdsurvivor #traumasurvivor
#traumarecovery #traumahealing

May be an image of text that says 'Toxic positivity looks like @what.is.mental.illness @thinkpresently Good vibes only Just be positive Think happy thoughts Validation and acceptance look like Embrace uncertainty It's ok to feel how feel Brave the uncomfortable React without judgement let go of what can't control My thoughts are passing clouds'.

node.text:
Toxic positivity is define as the excessive and ineffective overgeneralization of a happy, "good vibes only" and optimistic state across all situations.

Presently creates mindfulness bracelets engraved with phrases inspired by cognitive-behavioral therapy to remind us to acknowledge and accept our thoughts and feelings.

Instead of selling you toxic positivity, Presently is here to remind you to embrace all of yourself — the good, the bad, and the in-between. When we allow ourselves to experience life authentically, we can learn to better cope with life's difficult situations.

As someone who’s struggling with intrusive thoughts, my favorite bracelet is this one : "My thoughts are passing clouds". 💭

You can shop these beautiful bracelets at Thinkpresently.com

What’s your favorite affirmation? Let @thinkpresenly know in the comments. 🤍

Follow @what.is.mental.illness 
for more educational content. ✨
_____________________________

#mentalhealth #selflove #selflovequotes 
#selfacceptance #positiveaffirmations
#bekindtoyourself #bekindalways 
#selfcarethreads #presentmoment
#affirmattionsoftheday

node.text:
Put a ❤️ in the comments if you can relate! 
#youarenotalone

Trauma is the result of extraordinarily stressful events that shatter your sense of security, making you feel helpless in a dangerous world. Trauma can leave you struggling with upsetting emotions, memories, nightmares and anxiety that won’t go away. It can also leave you feeling numb, disconnected, and unable to trust other people. (From Helpguide.org)

PART 1 entire made by @what.is.mental.illness ‘s community 🤍 A special thank you for all your answers. The purpose of this project is to give people living with trauma the space to be heard and to raise awareness the impacts. 

*I received way more answers than expected. Obsviously, I can’t put them all in only one post so I want will several parts. 🤍

If you need help right now, don’t hesitate and call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-8255. You can also text START to 741-741 to reach the Crisis Text Line. 

Follow @what.is.mental.illness 
for more educational content. ❤️
_____________________________

#trauma #ptsd #cptsd
#ptsdawareness #ptsdrecovery 
#ptsdsurvivor #traumasurvivor
#traumarecovery #traumahealing

Photo by Jade | Special Educator in Montreal, Quebec with @treatmyocd. May be an image of text that says 'How to manage intrusive thoughts @what.is.mental.illness @treatmyocd Try to: Acknowledge the thought as being "intrusive". Try not to: Engage or interact with the thought. Accept their presence and welcome them. You can say "I hear you, welcome". Analyze the thoughts or figure out what your thoughts "mean". Remind yourself that thoughts are just thoughts. Suppress or push the thoughts away. Continue doing whatever you were doing prior to the intrusive thought. Judge yourself for having intrusive thoughts. Thoughts are not facts. They do not define you.'.

node.text:
Leave a 💜 in the comments if you’ve ever experienced intrusive thoughts 🙇🏼‍♀️

Intrusive thoughts are unwanted thoughts, images, or urges that pop into your head and can occur out of nowhere. Almost everyone experiences intrusive thoughts, however for people with OCD, it’s more complicated. People with OCD may experience intrusive thoughts more often and may become more worried by them than people without OCD. These thoughts become distressing to the point where you feel you must find a way to eradicate them through taking action. 

Here are a few steps for managing intrusive thoughts. 🌪

Source: Psychology today 

If you have ever experienced a distressing intrusive thought, you are not alone. I’ve partnered with NOCD, whose mission is to end the suffering caused by OCD. They provide affordable, effective and convenient OCD therapy online so people anywhere in the US, Canada, UK, or Australia can access exposure and response prevention (ERP) therapy with a qualified OCD therapist. You can do live, face to face video sessions with one of their licensed ERP therapists and get 24/7 support between sessions from the NOCD app. For more information, please see the link in their bio! #ocd #nocd #ocdtherapy #erptherapy
__________

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Jade | Special Educator on August 12, 2021. May be an image of one or more people, flower and text that says 'SUBTLE SIGNS YOU NEED TO TAKE A MENTAL HEALTH DAY @what.is.mental.illness'.

node.text:
Leave a ❤️ in the comments if you need a mental health break 🚨

As you probably seen, I took a few weeks off . 
I needed a break from creating content. It’s so easy to fall into a vicious cycle of perfectionism, productivity and overwork. I was exhausted, I was lacking motivation and energy. I was more anxious in the past weeks than I’ve been in the last year ⚠️ I decided to take a break and enjoy some times with my loved ones. I’m feeling way better now and I’m coming back stronger with this important post.

I often wait until I hit rock bottom and exhaustion to take a mental health day. (I definitely need to work on that)😰. Please, remember that your mental health is just as important as your physical health. You need to rest, you need to take care of yourself and take some ‘me time’. 

Knowing the signs can help you prevent feelings of fatigue, exhaustion, depression, anxiety, burnout, helplessness and so many more.

✨ Follow @what.is.mental.illness for 
more mental health tools & resources 
_________________

Photo by Jade | Special Educator on July 29, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Trauma is the same thing as Post-traumatic stress disorder Misconceptions about trauma @what.is.mental.illness You have to be physically hurt to experience trauma Fight or Flight are the only responses to trauma Trauma is only the really big things, like physical and sexual abuse We have control over our fight/ flight/freeze response Struggling with trauma is sign of weakness If force myselfto stop thinking about the trauma, it will go away You only experience trauma after a life- threatening event'.

node.text:
Leave a YES in the comments if you learned something new about trauma today! 🤍

When trauma was first conceptualized, it was defined as a ‘’catastrophic event outside the usual human experience”. At the time, people linked trauma with specific events such as war, torture, and the Holocaust. However, more research on neurobiology, the human experience, and even current events have open the door to a broader conversation about how many of us are truly exposed to trauma.

So, what is trauma? And who gets to decide?👇🏼

Trauma is any event or experience that overwhelms the brain’s ability to cope, and shapes our beliefs or behaviors going forward. Even more simply, it is anything that causes an individual deep, lasting distress during and/or after the event has taken place. Ultimately, trauma is less about what happened, and more about one’s subjective experience of it. 😵‍💫

Thanks to experts in the field of research, we know a lot more about trauma then we used to. Dr. Peter Levine in his book Waking the Tiger writes, “What most people don’t know is that many seemingly benign situations can be traumatic… The consequences of trauma can be widespread and hidden.”

Here are a few common misconceptions about trauma, debunked. The explanations are in the comments 🙌🏼

List any others misconceptions about trauma that you ever heard! 

Sources: Caption from “A Therapist Debunks Common Misconceptions About Trauma” | Psychology Today | Health & Wellness | Live Free Counseling 

✨ Follow @what.is.mental.illness for 
more mental health tools & resources 
_________________

May be an image of one or more people and text that says 'What.is.mental.illness @jade_larivee If you're living with stress anxiety, depression or if you're having trouble sleeping, I really suggest this app It made a huge difference for my mental health so maybe it'll help you too. Link in bio #Ad'.
Photo by Jade | Special Educator on July 28, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'WHAT DOES GASLIGHTING SOUND LIKE? AND HOW TO RESPOND @what.is.mental.illness'.

node.text:
Put a ❤️ in the comments if any of these phrases sound familiar.

Gaslighting isn’t always easy to recognize, especially since it often starts small, and other behaviors can sometimes seem similar. True gaslighting develops into a repeated pattern of manipulation. The person gaslighting you generally wants you to doubt yourself and depend on their version of reality. So, someone who offers a different opinion than yours, even in a rude or critical way, isn’t necessarily gaslighting.

People sometimes feel convinced of their own knowledge and insist they’re right, even when evidence suggests otherwise. Insisting “You’re wrong! I know what I’m talking about” isn’t necessarily polite, but it’s generally not gaslighting if they aren’t trying to manipulate you.

People can also gaslight unintentionally. “I don’t have time to listen to this” or “Don’t you think you’re overreacting?” may not be helpful responses, but they don’t always mean the other person wants to manipulate you.
When considering whether someone is trying to gaslight you, take stock of your feelings, not just their actions. You can take a look at my previous post about gaslighting for more informations. 🧠

Gaslighting works because it confuses you and shakes your confidence. If you show that the behavior doesn’t bother you, the person trying to gaslight you may decide it isn’t worth the struggle. In addition to lies and misdirection, gaslighting often involves criticism and insults. Calling these out — calmly and politely — shows them you won’t accept the behavior. Don’t be afraid to speak up, since making others aware of the situation gives them more incentive to leave you alone. If they continue challenging you, don’t get drawn into conflict. Arguing can lead to further tension and put you in a position where you’re more vulnerable to manipulation. By refusing to argue, you protect yourself and maintain control over the situation. 🗣

Sources : Caption from Healthline : Think You're Being Gaslit? Here's How to Respond. | Psychology Group 

✨ Follow @what.is.mental.illness for 
more mental health tools & resources 
_________________

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Jade | Special Educator on July 28, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'WHAT DOES GASLIGHTING SOUND LIKE? AND HOW TO RESPOND @what.is.mental.illness'.
